Question
========

Below is SPSS output from a sample T test regarding decrease in blood pressure after medication. The output tests the hypothesis tested that the mean decrease in the population, Î¼, is equal to 10. With a two-sided risk of 5%, the conclusion should be

![](uva-one-sample-mean-350-nl-graph01.png)

Answerlist
----------

* T-value falls in the critical range, reject H0.
* T-value falls in the critical range, do not reject H0.
* T-value does not fall into the critical range, reject H0.
* T-value does not fall into the critical range, do not reject H0.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* T-value falls in the critical range, reject H0...: Incorrect
* T-value falls in the critical range, reject H0 not...: Incorrect
* T-value does not fall in the critical range, reject H0...: Incorrect
* T-value does not fall into the critical range, do not reject H0...: Correct
